# chomp

> Local OpenAI-compatible LLM proxy. Routes to free model providers. Built for AI agents.

## What is chomp?

chomp is a Go server that runs on localhost and exposes a standard OpenAI-compatible API.
It routes requests to whichever free/cheap model providers you've configured.
No vendor lock-in. No cost. Just set your API keys and go.

## Quick start

```bash
# Set your API key
export OPENAI_BASE_URL=http://localhost:8001/v1
export OPENAI_API_KEY=<your-chomp-token>

# Chat completion (standard OpenAI format)
curl $OPENAI_BASE_URL/chat/completions \
  -H "Authorization: Bearer $OPENAI_API_KEY" \
  -H "Content-Type: application/json" \
  -d '{"messages":[{"role":"user","content":"hello"}]}'

# List all available models
curl $OPENAI_BASE_URL/models -H "Authorization: Bearer $OPENAI_API_KEY"
```

## Endpoints

- `POST /v1/chat/completions` — OpenAI-compatible chat completion (synchronous)
- `GET /v1/models` — list all models from all configured routers
- `POST /api/dispatch` — async dispatch (returns job ID, poll /api/result/:id)
- `GET /api/models/:router` — list models for a specific router
- `GET /api/models/free` — list free OpenRouter models

## Routers

chomp routes to these providers (configure via env vars):

| Router | Env Var | Free Tier | Speed |
|--------|---------|-----------|-------|
| OpenCode Zen | OPENCODE_ZEN_API_KEY | Free premium models | ~2-7s |
| Groq | GROQ_API_KEY | 30 req/min free | ⚡ ~200ms |
| Cerebras | CEREBRAS_API_KEY | Free tier | ⚡ fast |
| SambaNova | SAMBANOVA_API_KEY | Free cloud | fast |
| Together | TOGETHER_API_KEY | $1 free credit | good |
| Fireworks | FIREWORKS_API_KEY | $1 free credit | fast |
| OpenRouter | OPENROUTER_API_KEY | Free :free models | varies |

## Router selection

Add `"router": "groq"` to the request body to pick a specific router.
Omit it or use `"auto"` to let chomp pick the first configured router.

## Auth

Set `CHOMP_API_TOKEN` env var. Pass as `Authorization: Bearer <token>`.
Set `CHOMP_V1_NO_AUTH=1` to disable auth for trusted local-only setups.

## Source

https://github.com/acoyfellow/chomp

## Docs

https://chomp.coey.dev
